result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lucas R Lindner in court with attorney David Allan Nelson.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF1061, Court grants the State's motion.
fax dated 4/27/15 filed by Attorney Nelson; regarding the plea/sentencing hearing set for 4/27/15
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lucas R Lindner in court with attorney David Allan Nelson.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Nelson would like to speak with his client regarding State's offer and time to submit material to the court prior to sentencing.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lucas R Lindner

IN ADDITION TO THE SIGNATURE BOND
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report to WCS immediately after release to be drug tested.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Lucas R Lindner in court with attorney David Allan Nelson by phone.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses non-compliance letter.  
Atty. Nelson notes that his client is diabetic and could be causing the positive results.  
State requests an increase in bond.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucas R Lindner in court with attorney David Allan Nelson.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court address positive drug test from WCS.  Defendant will be paying to send the test out and states he has not been using.  Court orders that if the defendant doesn't pay for it today the court will issue a capias.  Court sets over until Monday.  Hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucas R Lindner in court with attorney David Allan Nelson.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Nelson was just appointed on the case and would like time to pretrial the case. Atty. Nelson requests 30 days.  
Court addresses WCS letter.  Defendant to go to WCS immediatly after court and be drug tested.  If postive defendant to return to court immediately.  
Court speaks to the defendant regarding not being able to give a sample.  Hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Court takes no action as to bail today but notes that upon another non-compliance letter the court will issue a capias.
